result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shane R Devalk

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: 06/18/15 sentencing hearing.
Calendar call on May 13, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Shane R Devalk in court with Attorney Amy C Scholz.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  This case is dismissed and read-in for Defendant's plea to Case #14CF386.  Calendar call scheduled for May 13, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
Hearing on April 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Exhibit #1

Defendant Shane R Devalk in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for continued Motion hearing. Detective Herrmann sworn-in and testifies. Cross examination by Atty Scholz. Testimony closed. Atty Scholz moves Exhibit #1 into evidence. Court receives Exhibit#1. Closing statements by the State. Closing statements by Atty Scholz. Court grants Motion to Suppress as far as protective sweep of upper unit on 09/08/14. Court reviews search warrants filed under 14GF435 & 14GF436. Court finds search warrant supports probable cause and that lawful search occured. The State requests that 14CF386 be re-set for Jury trial, and have this case tag along.  Hearing scheduled for April 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: 12/18/15 motion hearing.
Motion hearing on January 29, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Shane R Devalk in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for motion hearing. State challenges Defendant's residence. Defendant Shane R. Devalk is sworn-in and testifies regarding his residency. Cross examination by the State. Detective Aaron Hoppe sworn-in and testifies for the State. Atty Scholz requests sequestration of witnesses. Court grants request, and witnesses leave. Cross examination by Atty Scholz. Defense Exhibit #1 marked. Re-direct by the State. Re-cross by Atty Scholz. Atty Galaviz request adjournment to call additional witnesses. Atty Scholz objects to the request. Court grants request to adjourn. Atty Scholz raises issue of discovery requests with the State.  Motion hearing scheduled for January 29, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
Motion hearing on December 18, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Motion hearing on December 15, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
to Suppress filed by Defense
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.

Defendant Shane R Devalk in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests a motion hearing date on 14CF1041 and status/trial on 14CF386. Court grants request.  Motion hearing scheduled for December 15, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Shane R Devalk in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
  Hearing scheduled for October 3, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 25, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Shane R Devalk in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 25, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on September 15, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program.  Defendant to report within the first business day after posting bail or released from custody.  Defendant is allowed huber bailee status.

Defendant Shane R Devalk in court, in custody, with attorney Nicole Masnica for attorney Amy C Scholz.   Margaret Drees appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for September 15, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
